metadata.title: CVE-2018-5168 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Sites can bypass security checks on permissions to install lightweightthemes by manipulating the "baseURI" property of the theme element. Thiscould allow a malicious site to install a theme without user interactionwhich could contain offensive or embarrassing images. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 52.8, Thunderbird ESR < 52.8, Firefox < 60, andFirefox ESR < 52.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
